website_summaries.verdict: An excellent choice for both pros and hobbyists, this well-built machine is worth the investment for those who want quality.
pros: Precise, heavy-duty cabinet saw with an exceptional safety system
cons: It's heavy and fairly expensive, and occasional alignment issues have been reported

customer_reviews.title: Suggest you Buy Direct From SawStop
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints about the saw. I bought this through Amazon. It arrived without all the parts and I ended up having to purchase the parts again since Amazon would not assist me. Better to just avoid the middleman on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Thomas D. McCoy

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: I have now owned my Saw Stop for one year. I’m a retiree who enjoys making furniture and such for family. I am so sorry that I didn’t get this sooner. The safety was my first consideration, but after following the remarkably easy assembly instructions I was amazed at the quality of the machine’s construction. After having worked in a high-end machine shop for several years I was able to identify many, many features that testify to its quality. Material of construction Fit Finish Engineering/design Was the extra $1000 an issue for me? Yes, but in retrospect I am so glad I’ve invested in a well-made machine.
customer_reviews.author: SirJohn

customer_reviews.title: you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Nice, well constructed table saw. Cuts great. Safety feature is a little pricing, but what's a finger worth? Only critical comment is the instructions should be a bit more explicit on enuring the table extensions are oriented correctly when mounting. Put the left table extension on backwards and wasn't able to mount switch box until I figured out what I had done wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Mikje

customer_reviews.title: SawStop is a Must-Have
customer_reviews.text: With the flesh-sensing technology the SawStop table saw is probably the best table saw ever! This was a fantastic addition to my workshop. I know folks that have lost fingers in table saws and I know that even while practicing the best safety skills, people make mistakes and that's how accidents happen. So this saw is a must-have, and even more-so if you have kids learning woodworking... think about it.
customer_reviews.author: Finger_Lakes

customer_reviews.title: Sawstop tops anything I have used
customer_reviews.text: When the truck arrived with this heavy mama, I knew I was in for a treat. I was amazed at the attention to detail when it came to assembly. I actually READ everything carefully when I assembled it and the engineers who put the parts and instructions together did a masterful job! This is a fine, well engineered machine with very close tolerances. Be sure to get mobile base if you ever need to move it. I still treat this spinning blade as though it will NOT stop. Extremely pleased I went the extra $ mile and got a quality machine.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny T

customer_reviews.title: Great saw.  Safe saw.  Required almost no adjustment even after shipping.
customer_reviews.text: I loved my 52 inch Sawstop contractor saw with Mobile base but lost it in Camp Fire in Paradise, California Nov 8, 2018 with rest of my shop. I upgraded to the Professional 1.75 hp, 36 inch and it is an improvement. I originally went with the Sawstop upgrade from my Craftsman. As I am a surgeon and could easily see a career ending injury after the guy doing our kitchen cabinet remodel cut off 4 of his fingers. He had been building cabinets for over 40 years and no prior injury.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle

customer_reviews.title: Wow, wow, and wow.
customer_reviews.text: It's really great, a super useful safety feature on a very well made saw. Every part is made with great materials and precision. One thing I don't usually think about, the assembly instructions. There are many many parts to put together, but the instructions are second to none. Very clear and logical and very clearly labeled. A fairly complicated task made simple. It still takes some time, but there won't be any confusion.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Brown

customer_reviews.title: Quality saw.
customer_reviews.text: Setup was great, well document, well labeled. Absolutely perfectly square spindle and blade out of the box, and 90 and 45 degree stops were dead on. Table top was very well finished, wings were easy to level, and the cast wings were wider than my old powermatic 66. Fence is very good. I was a little worried about the power as I was used to 3HP but have only tripped the breaker once cutting wet 2x6 lumber. cons: dust collection comes straight off the blade, so the base tends to get piles of dust accumulating. cost about 1,000 more than comparable saws -- for the safety feature (auto stop), I figure a finger is worth more than that.
customer_reviews.author: C. M. Torgeson

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, yes. But cheaper than a visit to the ER.
customer_reviews.text: Be forewarned. If you trip the safety feature it will cost you about $150 to change the brake cartridge and blade, but that is about $2000 cheaper than going to the ER for stitches, if you're lucky. It'll cost you $15000 (not a typo) for reattachment surgery, if it can be reattached, and after that you probably won't be able to bend it Buy this if you don't want to walk around looking like an incompetent yakuza.
customer_reviews.author: anthony

customer_reviews.title: SawStop--Why Did I Wait So Long?
customer_reviews.text: The SawStop PCS175-TGP236 is an extremely well-made table saw. Fit and finish is excellent, and the accuracy is eyewatering--less than .010" tolerances in most instances. Takes 4-5 hours to assemble, but the incredibly meticulous instructions are very comprehensive. The finished product is a joy to use. Although a bit pricey, the added SawStop blade intake feature is worth paying the additional premium.
customer_reviews.author: Bob S.

customer_reviews.title: great saw!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say that hasnt already been said? Dust collection is good, the fit and finish is great. Saw adjusts smoothly, only slight lag with 6/4 hard maple. I love having 52 inches of capacity. Don't think I would ever want a non-biesemeyer fence. Having broken many stock inserts on my previous saws, these are great! A bit of chipping when bringing the blade through a new insert though. I also love the fact that I can upgrade the saw to a 3hp motor for 4-500 bucks when I upgrade my shop with 220v circuits.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Clay Nelson

customer_reviews.title: I've only made a few cuts but so far I'm really pleased with my choice of saw
customer_reviews.text: This saw is incredible. Granted, it's my first cabinet saw but assembly and setup went smoothly. The only thing the saw needed during setup was a little adjustment to the fence. Other than that, everything was within spec. I've only made a few cuts but so far I'm really pleased with my choice of saw.
customer_reviews.author: J. Plemons

customer_reviews.title: Don’t hesitate to Buy!
customer_reviews.text: The best tool and saw I’ve ever owned!!! Love this Saw! Was extremely easy to assemble and get to work!
customer_reviews.author: Lou W.

customer_reviews.title: nice saw but top not flat
customer_reviews.text: Well made and accurate. The fence moves very smoothly and the blade raising and tilting wheels turn easily. Dust collection is good and it's a great looking saw. The cast iron top was not as flat as I would expect and when I contacted Sawstop they weren't much help, the Sawstop rep actually blamed me for not installing it correctly. I don't know how my installation could affect the flatness of the cast iron top. That being said I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: beezer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely outstanding saw. Worth every penny even without the ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely outstanding saw. Worth every penny even without the safety features.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel J. Traina

customer_reviews.title: Very accurately aligned
customer_reviews.text: It is a very expensive machine but good quality. Safety is one thing but all aligned precisely.
customer_reviews.author: KS2000

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: This saw is fantastic. Easy to assemble and very accurate out of the box. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: KYLE M.

customer_reviews.title: Works great. I've previously read other reviews regarding going slow ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I've previously read other reviews regarding going slow with hard woods and not forcing the wood through. This is true, but cuts just fine. I also cut some 1/4in birch plywood and it worked great. Came with a free roller base as part of an upgrade promotion. Assembly instructions could use some more defined pictures for the roller base just to make assembly somewhat quicker. FYI, DO NOT fully tighten down fence bolts. Hand tighten only.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Orosco

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend using assembly instructions in the Owners manual vice the ...
customer_reviews.text: Quality of design, fit and finish are outstanding. The saw is well worth the cost, especially from a safety perspective. It is the new crown jewel of my shop. The side table extension in the only exception as it is made of a softwood frame with laminate type covering. Highly recommend using assembly instructions in the Owners manual vice the laminated reference card. Also recommend 2 people for assembly, the saw and metal table wings are very heavy. It took me about 5 hours to assemble and make minor adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: Greg C it

customer_reviews.title: My last cabinet saw
customer_reviews.text: Fit and finish is excellent. 1.75 HP is plenty of power for the hobbyist. Yes, more power is better, but I don't regret saving money in this case since my last saw was a DeWalt 745. It is a huge upgrade for most people. It powers through 8/4 maple just fine. The biggest factor for cutting through thick material is a sharp blade. Besides, how often are you really working with thicker lumber than 8/4?
customer_reviews.author: Preston

customer_reviews.title: Look Ma... I still have all my fingers.
customer_reviews.text: Look Ma... I still have all my fingers. It's a very well made machine. No regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: This is a major upgrade to my delta tablesaw. ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a major upgrade to my delta tablesaw. It's very quiet, the cuts are precise and it is almost dust free when using a dust collector.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Boardman

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic saw, and the peace of mind is worth ...
customer_reviews.text: I won't say to much about this because everyone else has already said it. Fantastic saw, and the peace of mind is worth anything you feel is too much money.
customer_reviews.author: P^2

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, well designed table saw. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Randall J. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Sam Curtis Enterprise Alabama
customer_reviews.text: Only minor adjustments were required to the fence and bubble readout. The instructions for assembley could not have better. I am very pleased with the power and accuracy of my Sawstop.
customer_reviews.author: SHzStory

customer_reviews.title: runs beautifully. Very smooth and accurate
customer_reviews.text: The saw stop needed some shipping adjustments to complete the setup, but once tuned, runs beautifully. Very smooth and accurate...quality is evident.
customer_reviews.author: johnran2

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier
customer_reviews.text: Performs incredible and you can't beat the safety features. Couldn't be happier
customer_reviews.author: Adam Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: The Finest
customer_reviews.text: Clearly the finest Table Saw I've used. All is precise and solid.
customer_reviews.author: W. Delarosa

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: Had a few issues with the saw but the customer service from saw stop is first class. This is a great saw and a welcome addition to any shop. Everything fits together like it should, very easy assembly instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Paulie

customer_reviews.title: A must have saw!!
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this saw screams craftsmanship. If you are in need of a table saw you must at least look at this saw first, because you will have to have it.
customer_reviews.author: James Sandoval

customer_reviews.title: High quality product and documentation
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed with the product documentation. Clearly written and color coded, including the hardware. The saw runs smoothly, was relatively easy to set up, and is easy to adjust for the most part. My only complaints are as follows: First, adjustment of the parallelism of blade to miter slot is difficult. Access to adjustment points is very limited. Second, I was surprised at having to buy a special cartridge for use with a dado set. That was not made clear in the advertising BS.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas D. Abbott

product_meta.title: SAWSTOP 10-Inch Professional Cabinet Saw, 1.75-HP, 36-Inch Professional TGlide Fence System (PCS175-TGP236)
product_meta.description: The SawStop® 1.75HP Professional Cabinet Saw with 36" Professional T-Glide Fence System offers versatility and safety. It delivers the performance you need with the peace of mind only SawStop patented safety system can provide.
feature_bullets: 36-INCH T-GLIDE FENCE ASSEMBLY: The 36-inch T-Glide Fence & Rail are made of heavy-gauge steel for sure lockdown and reliably square cutting for years without deflection.

SAWSTOP PATENTED SAFETY SYSTEM: Stops a spinning blade on contact with skin. The blade stops in less than 5 milliseconds, and drops below the table, minimizing a potentially life-altering injury to a mere scratch.

UNMATCHED QUALITY: The trunnion and arbor are built for precision, strength and stability. The gas piston elevation delivers smooth and easy adjustability. Table flatness is measured diagonally at 0.010” maximum gap.

DUST COLLECTION: 99% dust collection is delivered above the table with the available dust collection blade guard (Model # TSG-DC, sold separately), and below the table with advanced shrouding around the blade. Available Overarm Dust Collection (Model # TSA-ODC, sold separately) routes dust away from the blade and into the 4” port.
RELIABILITY: The Control Box houses the on-off switch, power paddle, and on-board computer, and constantly checks that all systems are working to reliably keep you safe.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars78 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
